means: 教训（通常是长篇大论的）

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些名词均含"演讲，讲话，报告"之意。
sameAnalysis.word_list: address, speech, lecture, oration, report, talk
means: address ：正式用词，指在庄严隆重的场合作精心准备的演讲或正式演说。
speech ：普通用词，指一般的发言或讲话，可以是事先准备的，也可以是即席的。
oration ：常指在特殊场合，辞藻华丽，形式庄重，旨在激发听众感情的正式演说。
report ：一般是指下级给上级或负责人给委托机关的书面或口头报告。
talk ：常用词，强调非正式讲话，讲话方式一般较为自由。
class ： 从"班级"引申指学生在一起上课，还可表示"(一节)课"。
lesson ： 主要指教材中的一课或每次授课的单位时间。
course ： 指在一段时间内教完或学完的完整的课程。

sentence.Network_en: Chuck would lecture me, telling me to get a haircut.
sentence.Network_cn: 查克就会数落我，让我去理一下发。

sentence.Network_en: Within this lecture I cannot pretend to deal adequately with dreams.
sentence.Network_cn: 在这一次讲座中，我不敢自诩能对梦境作透彻的分析。

sentence.Network_en: Our captain gave us a stern lecture on safety.
sentence.Network_cn: 船长就安全问题严厉地训斥了我们一顿。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (in the sense 'reading, a text to read'): from Old French, or from medieval Latin lectura, from Latin lect- 'read, chosen', from the verb legere

entry.tran: （通常指大学或学院里的）演讲，讲座，讲课
entry.def: A lecture is a talk someone gives in order to teach people about a particular subject, usually at a university or college.

example.ex: ...a series of lectures by Professor Eric Robinson...
example.tran: 埃里克·鲁宾逊教授的系列讲座

example.ex: In his lecture Riemann covered an enormous variety of topics.
example.tran: 里曼的演讲涵盖了各种各样的主题。

entry.def: If you lecture on a particular subject, you give a lecture or a series of lectures about it.

example.ex: She then invited him to Atlanta to lecture on the history of art...
example.tran: 她于是邀请他去亚特兰大讲艺术史。

example.ex: She has danced, choreographed, lectured and taught all over the world...
example.tran: 她到过世界各地跳舞、编舞、演讲和教学。

entry.def: If someone lectures you about something, they criticize you or tell you how they think you should behave.

example.ex: He used to lecture me about getting too much sun...
example.tran: 他以前常唠叨我太阳晒得太多。

example.ex: Chuck would lecture me, telling me to get a haircut...
example.tran: 查克就会数落我，让我去理一下发。

means.word_mean: 1. a speech that is open to the public;

sentences.sentence: "a good lecture was my father's idea of discipline"
"the teacher gave him a talking to"

means.word_mean: 3. teaching by giving a discourse on some subject (typically to a class)

sentences.sentence: "She will talk at Rutgers next week"
"The mother scolded the child for entering a stranger's car"
"The customer dressed down the waiter for bringing cold soup"

collect[v.收集]+ive……的→adj.集体的,共同的 n.集体
elect[v.选举,推选;选择,作出选择]+ion表名词→n.选举,选择权;当选

intel=inter在……中间+lect选择,收集→在中间选出的人→智者
intellect[n.理智,智力,才智]+ual……的→n.知识分子 adj.智力的,理智的,有理解力的

select[v.选出]+ion表名词→n.选择,挑选;选集,精选物
acro高+lect讲,读,说→高层说的话
dia对着+lect讲,读,说→两个对着说→方言
idio个人的+lect说→个人说的话
neg没有+lect选择,收集→没有选出→疏忽
lect讲,读,说+ure表名词→n.&v.演讲,讲课
col共同+lect选择→放在一起选择→收集

Sentence.sentence: The man had difficulty understanding the lecture.
Smith gives lectures regularly on TOne great challenge for the U.S. economy is slack domestic consumer demand. Americans are paying down debt, saving more, and spending more carefully.read>0

And though Hu Jintao and the rest of the Chinese leadership aren't inclined to lecture visiting Presidents, he might gently hint that Beijing is getting a little nervous about the value of the dollar-which has fallen 15% since March, in large part because of increasing fears that America's debt load is becoming unmanageable.
Picture a typical MBA lecture theatre twenty years ago.

means.word_mean: （通常指大学里的）讲座，讲课，演讲

sentences.en: I take it as a pleasure to attend your lecture.
My father gave me a lecture for smoking.
sentences.cn: 我父亲因我吸烟而训斥我。

means.word_mean: （尤指在大学里）开讲座，讲授，讲课

sentences.en: He was asked to lecture in America.
He's lecturing a group of tourists.
sentences.cn: 他在向一群观光者作报告。

means.word_mean: 责备, 教训, 训斥

sentences.en: He lectured me heatedly for a few minutes.
sentences.cn: 他非常激烈地训了我几分钟。

jushi.english: My father gave me a lecture for smoking.
jushi.chinese: 我父亲因我吸烟而训斥我。

jushi.english: I should have attended the lecture yesterday, but I was not fit.
jushi.chinese: 昨天我本应去听讲座,但身体不好没有去。

jushi.english: It is difficult to understand his books, much more his lectures.
jushi.chinese: 他的书很难理解,他的讲演更难理解。
